discovery_instructions: Identify what the main item/entity is for this feature (e.g., ticket, workflow, employee, record)
Look for list/table views - the rows represent the primary entity
Check page headers and breadcrumbs for entity naming
Note the singular and plural forms used in the UI

find_trigger: Look for buttons with: + Add, + Create, + New, plus icon
Check top-right corner of the page
Look in empty state messages for create prompts
create.validation: New item appears in list with unique identifier

find_trigger: Click on any row in a list/table
Look for 'View' or eye icon buttons
Check if rows are clickable (cursor changes)
read.validation: Detail panel, modal, or page opens showing full information

find_trigger: Look for Edit button, pencil icon
Check for inline editing (click on field to edit)
Look for status change dropdowns or buttons
Check action menus (three-dot menu) for edit option
update.validation: Changes persist after save, reflected in list view

find_trigger: Look for Delete button, trash icon
Check action menus (three-dot menu) for delete option
Look for bulk delete with checkboxes
Some features use 'Archive' or 'Cancel' instead of delete
delete.validation: Item removed from list or status changed to deleted/archived

instructions: Navigate to the feature's main section
Take a full page snapshot to understand the layout
Identify the primary entity - what 'item' does this feature manage?
Find ALL clickable elements: buttons, links, tabs, dropdowns, icons
Map the navigation structure: tabs, sidebar items, breadcrumbs
Click each tab/sub-section and document what appears
Locate CRUD controls for the primary entity
Check for action menus (three-dot menus, right-click menus)
Document any modals, dialogs, slide-out panels
Identify form fields and input types when forms appear
Look for filters, search, sort, and export options
Check for bulk action controls (checkboxes, select all)
Note any settings or configuration options
discovery_targets: List/table of items with row actions

check_instructions: Navigate to Automations in the left sidebar
Click + Create workflow (or similar create button)
In trigger selection, search for this feature's name
Check if this feature appears as a trigger source
Document any trigger events found (e.g., 'item created', 'status changed')
Check Actions section for actions related to this feature

execution_order: 1. EXPLORATION: Navigate to feature and discover all UI elements
2. IDENTIFY ENTITY: Determine what the primary item/entity is
3. CRUD TEST: Test create, read, update, delete for the primary entity
4. WORKFLOW CHECK: Verify if feature has workflow triggers/actions
5. WHAT_TO_DO: Execute specific validation tasks from payload
6. DOCUMENTATION: Capture screenshots of key screens

what_to_do.task: Manage company documentation including assigning roles, uploading documents, generating official letters, and setting up bank accounts.
steps: Assign roles to team members by selecting appropriate roles and defining access levels.
Upload company documents by collecting required documents, verifying details, and uploading to centralized storage.
Generate official letters by selecting letter templates and obtaining signatory approval.
Set up company bank accounts by gathering bank details and inputting account information.
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Successful management of company documentation with proper role assignments, document uploads, letter generation, and bank account setup.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Deleted letter requests cannot be recovered by users, causing compliance and record-keeping challenges.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat admin panel lacks deletion tracking and self-service recovery for deleted documents; manual backend intervention is required.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Contact support for backend recovery of deleted letter requests.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Custom fields marked as hidden from employees cannot be used in letter templates, limiting template flexibility.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Platform restricts use of certain custom fields in letter templates based on visibility settings.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: No workaround available; requires platform-level fix.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Letter requests require external stamping and re-uploading, but the platform does not support post-approval document uploads or status changes.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No flexible document approval workflow for post-approval modifications or uploads.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual handling outside the platform is needed for stamped documents.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Automatic approval configuration can bypass manual signatory review without clear warnings, risking unintended approvals.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Auto-sign feature can be enabled without explicit user guidance or confirmation prompts.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users should verify auto-sign settings carefully to avoid unintended approvals.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Letter template preview masks sensitive variables with 'XXX', causing user confusion about data representation.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Privacy design masks salary variables in previews without clear communication.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users should understand 'XXX' placeholders indicate masked data, not errors.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Letter request approvals are not supported in the mobile app, limiting workflow to the web platform.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Mobile app lacks full approval workflow capabilities for letter requests.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Use web platform for approval processes.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No dedicated reporting mechanism exists for letter request workflows, limiting tracking and audit capabilities.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Lack of out-of-the-box reports for letter request lifecycle and metadata.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Letter Requests module lacks multi-company template management and employee self-service features.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Administrators must manually update letter details and references; no automation or multi-company support.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Text formatting such as bold is not preserved in variable fields within letter templates.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Rich text formatting for variables is not supported in previews or final documents.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Avoid relying on formatting for variable fields.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Allowance variables cannot be displayed in tabular or multi-column formats in letter templates.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No advanced formatting options for compensation variables.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Incomplete backend implementation for letter request actions prevents full frontend interaction.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Frontend cannot render or manage all letter request actions due to backend gaps.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Limited frontend functionality until backend is completed.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Date range filtering for letter requests lacks a standardized reusable component, causing UI inconsistencies.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No uniform DateRangePicker component for letter request filters.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Inconsistent date filtering UI across platform.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No comprehensive letterhead configuration module for HR administrators to customize document branding.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Limited customization of letterhead and header designs.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual branding outside platform or limited customization.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Arabic letter request variables translation scope is unclear to users without support confirmation.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Unclear user experience regarding language variable translation completeness.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: PDF generation for letter request templates can produce excessively long documents with pagination issues.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Backend PDF generator has rendering and pagination inconsistencies.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual review and adjustment of generated PDFs.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Minor UI issue where tooltips show an extra '/' character causing visual confusion.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: No impact on core functionality; cosmetic only.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Letter request fonts default to Times New Roman ignoring user font selections.
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No robust font preservation in generated documents.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Accept default font or avoid custom fonts.
